intro: Strychnos eketensis, commonly known as the African poisonwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, including strychnine and brucine, which are responsible for its poisonous properties. It typically grows in moist forest environments and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided by both animals and humans.
